item.title: Bill add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "Night is not something to endure until dawn. It is an element, like wind or fire. Darkness is its own kingdom; it moves to its own laws, and many living things dwell in it." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Bill add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "The odd thing about people who had many books was how they always wanted more." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Bill add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "Words, he decided, were inadequate at best, impossible at worst. They meant too many things. Or they meant nothing at all." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Bill add a quote by Guy Gavriel Kay
item.description: "Do you know the wish of your heart?" - The Darkest Road" -- Guy Gavriel Kay

item.title: Bill add a quote by Lord Dunsany
item.description: "And little he knew of the things that ink may do, how it can mark a dead man's thought for the wonder of later years, and tell of happening that are gone clean away, and be a voice for us out of the dark of time, and save many a fragile thing from the pounding of heavy ages; or carry to us, over the rolling centuries, even a song from lips long dead on forgotten hills." -- Lord Dunsany
